text: Supplied video obtained Tuesday, October 15, 2019, of Queen Elizabeth ll speaking from the Throne in the House of Lords during the state opening of parliament. The Queen's speech, written for the monarch by government officials, gives a brisk rundown of more than 20 laws Prime Minister Boris Johnson's administration hopes to pass in the coming months. "My government's priority has always been to secure the United Kingdom's departure from the European Union on the 31 October," the queen says. "My government intends to work towards a new partnership with the European Union, based on free trade and friendly cooperation". (AAP VIDEO/Supplied/parliamentlive.tv)
